body.p: Code templates are small document fragments that can be inserted quickly at the editing position and can be reused in other editing sessions. comes with a large set of ready-to use templates for XSL, XQuery, and XML Schema. You can even share your code templates with your colleagues using the template export and import functions.

ul.li: The shortcut key that activates the Content Completion Assistant on request is . It displays the code templates names in the content completion assistant list together with proposed element names.
The shortcut key that activates code templates assistant on request: . It displays only the code templates in the proposals list.

body.p: To configure the Code Templates options, and go to Editor Templates Code Templates . This preferences page contains a list with all available code templates (both built-in and custom created ones) and a code preview area. You can disable any code template by unchecking its corresponding option box.

dlentry.dd: Defines a new code template. You can choose to set the newly defined code template for a specific type of editor or for all editor types.
Creates a duplicate of the currently selected code template.
Deletes the currently selected code template. This action is disabled for the built-in code templates.
